what: Case study - 2013/14 DENV3 outbreak in Fiji
title: Estimate relative R0 from temperature data for vector-borne diseases with {climateR0}
text: first case study, ’ll use data 2013/4 DENV-3 outbreak Fiji. show laboratory confirmed cases time Central Division.  dataset, time-series monthly mean temperatures (°C) Central Division, Fiji. extract corresponding temperature-dependent R0 values temperature-relative R0 curves estimated Mordecai et al, use temperature_R0() function. Within function call, specify vector-pathogen code AeaeDENV vector Aedes aegypti pathogen dengue virus. Now can plot relative temperature-dependent R0 values alongside case data.   discussed Kucharski et al (2018), comparing case time series temperature-dependent R0 indicates fall transmission due seasonal temperature variation fully explain fall cases March 2014. paper, Kucharski colleagues found model including build-herd immunity decrease transmission resulting vector control campaign March 2024 better captured observed pattern cases.
code: fiji_cases <- fiji_2014 |>    ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(x = date, y = cases), col = "#016c59") +   ggplot2::scale_x_date(breaks = "month", date_labels = "%b-%y") +   ggplot2::labs(x = "Date", y = "Reported dengue cases") +   ggplot2::theme_classic()  fiji_cases fiji_2014$rR0 <- temperature_r0(fiji_2014$av_temp, "AeaeDENV") #> Returning relative R0 for vector: aedes_aegypti and pathogen: dengue_virus fiji_rR0 <- fiji_2014 |>    ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(x = date, y = rR0), col = "#54278f") +   ggplot2::scale_x_date(breaks = "month", date_labels = "%b-%y") +   ggplot2::labs(x = "Date", y = "Relative R0") +   ggplot2::theme_classic()  fiji_rR0 cowplot::plot_grid(fiji_cases, fiji_rR0, nrow = 2)

what: Case study - 2013/14 Zika outbreak in French Polynesia
title: Estimate relative R0 from temperature data for vector-borne diseases with {climateR0}
text: second study, ’ll use data 2013/4 Zika outbreak Tahiti, French Polynesia. show laboratory confirmed cases time sentinel reporting sites Tahiti.  dataset, time-series monthly mean temperatures (°C) Tahiti. , use temperature_R0() function. Within function call, specify vector-pathogen code AeaeZIKV vector Aedes aegypti pathogen Zika virus. (Note main vectors French Polynesia include Aedes aegypti Aedes polynesiensis.) Now can plot relative temperature-dependent R0 values alongside case data.   discussed Kucharski et al (201), outbreak ended temperature rainfall levels changed way imply transmission reduction, indicating immunity played major role driving epidemic decline. consistent later antibody data reported Aubry et al ( 2017)
code: tahiti_cases <- tahiti_2013 |>    ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(x = date, y = cases), col = "#016c59") +   ggplot2::scale_x_date(breaks = "month", date_labels = "%b-%y") +   ggplot2::labs(x = "Date", y = "Reported Zika cases") +   ggplot2::theme_classic()  tahiti_cases tahiti_2013$rR0 <- temperature_r0(tahiti_2013$av_temp, "AeaeZIKV") #> Returning relative R0 for vector: aedes_aegypti and pathogen: zika_virus tahiti_rR0 <- tahiti_2013 |>    ggplot2::ggplot() +   ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(x = date, y = rR0), col = "#54278f") +   ggplot2::scale_x_date(breaks = "month", date_labels = "%b-%y") +   ggplot2::labs(x = "Date", y = "Relative R0") +   ggplot2::theme_classic()  tahiti_rR0 cowplot::plot_grid(tahiti_cases, tahiti_rR0, nrow = 2)

title: Estimate relative R0 from temperature data for vector-borne diseases with {climateR0}
text: models used account aspects weather climate variability likely influence vector-borne disease dynamics, including variation precipitation, relative humidity, temperature time. approach also account time lags temperature R0; instead, calculates static snapshot relative temperature suitability transmission given point time, assuming temperature constant point. reality, multiple time lags may relevant R0. example, temperature 4-8 weeks ago may affect mosquito population size development rate, whereas temperature 2-4 weeks ago may affect vector competence extrinsic incubation period. Despite limitations, temperature-dependent relative R0 used predict geographical temporal variation different settings malaria, dengue, Zika, Ross River virus West Nile virus (details references ). Mordecai et al 2017 Tesla et al 2018 Shocket et al 2018 Shocket et al 2020 Childs et al 2024

title: Design Principles for {climateR0}
text: {climateR0} package allows estimation relative R0 mean temperature data climate sensitive pathogen/vector pairs. package directly estimate relative R0 temperature data instead interpolates constant temperature - R0 relationships Mordecai et al 2019. relative R0 can used generate simple short-term case forecasts.

title: Design Principles for {climateR0}
text: input output temperature_r0() function numeric vectors. function takes numeric vector mean temperature °C outputs numeric vector relative R0 (scaled 0 1) equal length input vector.

title: Design Principles for {climateR0}
text: {cinterpolate}

title: climateR0: Estimate Temperature-dependent R0 for Climate-Sensitive Pathogens — climateR0-package
text: Estimate temperature dependent R0 given pathogen vector temperature data using experimentally derived constant temperature-R0 curves.

what: Estimate relative R0 from mean temperature — temperature_r0
title: Estimate relative R0 from mean temperature — temperature_r0
text: function takes input series mean temperature values °C returns estimated relative R0 values specified vector pathogen.

title: Estimate relative R0 from mean temperature — temperature_r0
Estimate relative R0 from mean temperature — temperature_r0
text: data numeric vector mean temperature values °C vector_pathogen Character vector specifying vector pathogen interest can one following: AeaeDENV; AeaeZIKV; AealDENV; AetaRVFV; AetaSINV; AetrEEEV; AngaPfal; CxanMVEx; CxanRRVx; CxpiSINV; CxpiWNVxl; CxtaWEEV; CxtaWNVx; CxunWNVx

title: Estimate relative R0 from mean temperature — temperature_r0
text: Numeric vector relative R0 values corresponding input temperature values

title: Estimate relative R0 from mean temperature — temperature_r0
text: Mordecai, E. ., Caldwell, J. M., Grossman, M. K., Lippi, C. ., Johnson, L. R., Neira, M., Rohr, J. R., Ryan, S. J., Savage, V., Shocket, M. S., Sippy, R., Stewart Ibarra, . M., Thomas, M. B., Villena O. (2019). Thermal biology mosquito-borne disease. Ecol Lett. 22(10) doi:10.1111/ele.13335

title: Estimate relative R0 from mean temperature — temperature_r0
code: # Return relative R0 for Aedeas aegypti and dengue virus for mean temperatures from 18-36°C temperature_r0(c(18,20,22,24,26,28,30,32,34,36), "AeaeDENV") #> Returning relative R0 for vector: aedes_aegypti and pathogen: dengue_virus #>  [1] 0.0007878388 0.0400522079 0.1638852609 0.4015152843 0.7112617676 #>  [6] 0.9574281565 0.9645956733 0.6630981443 0.1923898126 0.0000000000
